intro: Charpentiera obovata var. elliptica, commonly known as the elliptic charpentiera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, obovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
